lines.text: [as Charlie steps outside the Tea House, three college students follow him - Charlie starts to get on his motorcycle]
Is that your sickle?
You ought to stop reading those hot rod magazines, buddy. Sickle is out, it's either a bike or a motorcycle.
Made in Japan, huh?
That's right, made in Japan.
That your sickle?
Gotta stop reading those hot-rod magazines buddie, sickles are out - it's either a bike or a motorcycle.
Made in Japan huh.
That's right, made in Japan.
What's the matter, American sickles not good enough for you?
You don't dig world trade buddy after all the economics they've tried to shove into you.
I never thought I'd be running off with the circus.
Let's get one thing straight. This is not a circus. This is a carnival. There's a big difference.
I guess you're right. I guess a circus has elephants.
No, no! That's karate!
That goes with the sickle! Come on!
Hey, you!
Yeah?
[Charlie looks around but to no avail]
Down here, stupid.
Hey look, kid. You better wait till you grow up before you start picking fights with grown-ups.
What do you mean, kid? I'm 38.

[chuckles]
Congratulations.
Are you Charlie Rogers?
Yep.
Well, Joe's been looking for you. Come on.
I'll be back in ten minute with a football hero's lament 'I left my knee at USC'.
They're taking it bigger than usual.
Good.
Might mean trouble.
So what else is new?
Charlie why do you have to act so tough, what does it get you?
This is a real crummy joint, I've seen more action in a zoo.
Which side of the cage, pal?
Come on!
No, that's karate!
It goes with the sickle.
Stay out of trouble.
You're asking the impossible.
I'm not asking, I'm telling.
Just because you bailed me out doesn't mean you own me.
What do you do when you're not riding your bike?
Are you serious - me working in a circus?
Hey, don't you believe in knocking?
How do you knock on a tent?
What do you do here?
That depends, by day or night.
I hope you're not a mind-reader because if you are, I'm about to get my face slapped!
You will bring great financial reward to your native land.
Sure, but right now I'm a roustabout and the boss told me to come in here and give you a hand.
I can tell you what kind of woman will be attracted to you.
I think I'm old enough to figure that out for myself.
What do you see in my eyes?
Maybe I better slap your face!
I've got a pretty persuasive way about me.
You fascinate me.
Yeah, that's the best news I've heard all day.
No, I mean the way you go around the country with your guitar and a chip on your shoulder.
Are you cold or do I make you nervous?
Both.
You can come a bit closer you know, I give off plenty of body heat.
The time and the feelings match, no dice on the place.
I'm sorry Charlie, I like you too but you're just passing through.
